lines.text: Enter MISTRESS PAGE, MISTRESS QUICKLY, and WILLIAM PAGE

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Is he at Master Fords already, thinkst thou

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Sure he is by this, or will be presently: but, truly, he is very courageous mad about his throwing into the water. Mistress Ford desires you to come suddenly.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Ill be with her by and by Ill but bring my young man here to school. Look, where his master comes tis a playingday, I see. How now, Sir Hugh! no school today
Enter SIR HUGH EVANS

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: No Master Slender is let the boys leave to play.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Blessing of his heart!

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Sir Hugh, my husband says my son profits nothing in the world at his book. I pray you, ask him some questions in his accidence.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Come hither, William hold up your head come.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Come on, sirrah hold up your head answer your master, be not afraid.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: William, how many numbers is in nouns

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Two.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Truly, I thought there had been one number more, because they say, Ods nouns.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Peace your tattlings! What is fair, William

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Pulcher.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Polecats! there are fairer things than polecats, sure.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: You are a very simplicity oman: I pray you peace. What is lapis, William

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: A stone.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: And what is a stone, William

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: A pebble.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: No, it is lapis: I pray you, remember in your prain.

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Lapis.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: That is a good William. What is he, William, that does lend articles

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Articles are borrowed of the pronoun, and be thus declined, Singulariter, nominativo, hic, haec, hoc.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Nominativo, hig, hag, hog pray you, mark: genitivo, hujus. Well, what is your accusative case

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Accusativo, hinc.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: I pray you, have your remembrance, child, accusative, hung, hang, hog.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Hanghog is Latin for bacon, I warrant you.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Leave your prabbles, oman. What is the focative case, William

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: O,vocativo, O.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Remember, William focative is caret.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: And thats a good root.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Oman, forbear.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Peace!

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: What is your genitive case plural, William

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Genitive case!

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Ay.

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Genitive,horum, harum, horum.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: Vengeance of Jennys case! fie on her! never name her, child, if she be a whore.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: For shame, oman.

lines.speaker: mistress quickly
lines.text: You do ill to teach the child such words: he teaches him to hick and to hack, which theyll do fast enough of themselves, and to call horum: fie upon you!

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Oman, art thou lunatics hast thou no understandings for thy cases and the numbers of the genders Thou art as foolish Christian creatures as I would desires.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Prithee, hold thy peace.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: Show me now, William, some declensions of your pronouns.

lines.speaker: william page
lines.text: Forsooth, I have forgot.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: It is qui, quae, quod: if you forget your quies, your quaes, and your quods, you must be preeches. Go your ways, and play go.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: He is a better scholar than I thought he was.

lines.speaker: sir hugh evans
lines.text: He is a good sprag memory. Farewell, Mistress Page.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Adieu, good Sir Hugh. Get you home, boy. Come, we stay too long.
Exit SIR HUGH EVANS
Exeunt
